modules.description: This module facilitates declarative command-line interface design by defining flags, positional arguments, and constraint-enforcing modifiers that manage requirements like mandatory values or last-argument prioritization. It operates on structured specifications, configuration states, and environment variables, leveraging typed value converters to parse strings into OCaml values such as integers, lists, and tuples, including complex forms like validated file paths or comma-separated pairs. It is particularly suited for building robust CLIs with hierarchical argument validation, environment variable fallbacks, and structured input handling for configurations or data pipelines.
